articles.description: Going by reports floating around, CEO of Xiaomi, Lei Jun, has been caught using an iPhone on social media. The fact that this is news in the first place is a tad amusing, but it does play right into the joke of Xiaomi aping everything Apple does.
articles.content:
Want some pointless drama? Here's some pointless drama for you. According to reports surfacing on the Internet yesterday, Xiaomi CEO Lei Jun was caught using an iPhone. We're honestly not even sure why that's news at this point.
According to the report by Gi… [+832 chars]

articles.title: Fitbit may have a feature that could help find coronavirus symptom - Times of India
articles.description: Fitbit has a feature that can detect oxygen saturation levels and it could help anyone with Covid-19 to know the changes in their oxygen levels. Fitbi

articles.title: Not Zoom, here's the '3 million reason' Google Meet is free for everyone - Times of India
articles.description: Google's video-conferencing platform Google Meet is now free for everyone. Of course, you need an email ID to use it.

articles.author: IANS
articles.title: Facebook now allows for Messenger Rooms access from Facebook Events, Groups - India TV News
articles.description: Facebook Messenger Rooms group video calling platform was recently introduced to compete with Zoom, Google Meet and more
articles.content:
Image Source : FACEBOOKThe integration is available on Android, iOS, web

articles.title: Ludo King to Tambola: Mobile games that got popular amid lockdown - The Indian Express
articles.description: With mobile application versions of a plethora of classic old-school board games available at one’s fingertips, here is our look at some of the most popular games of the lockdown.
articles.content:
By: Tech Desk | New Delhi | 
Updated: May 14, 2020 10:02:23 am
Ludo King, Uno and Tambola are some of the most popular video games currently being played in India during the COVID-19 lockdown. (Illustration: Suvajit Dey)By Shubhang Gopal

articles.title: Honor X10 will feature Sony’s 40MP IMX600y sensor, X10 Pro comes with periscope lens - Gizchina.com
articles.description: According to a recent leak, the Honor X10 has a triple-camera setup led by Sony's 40MP IMX600y sensor. The X10 Pro comes with a periscope camera.
articles.content: After many rumors and leaks, it’s official the Honor X10 and X10 Pro are coming in the next week. Interestingly enough, Honor decided to publish some photo samples ahead of the launch. Despite the images, there’s still missing details about the camera setup. … [+1295 chars]
